title-group.article-title: Clear, Colored and Black Anodic Coatings for Passive Thermal Control of the International Space Station

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1996 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Clear, colored and black anodic coatings with controlled optical properties have been developed for passive thermal control of the International Space Station. Most parts, including the primary truss structure, require a sulfuric acid anodic coating. Space-stable colored anodic coatings were developed for astronaut handrails and positioning aids which require color coding; black anodic coating is specified in limited cases for thermal reasons. To date, many production parts have been anodized with these clear and colored processes. Controlling the optical properties on this variety of parts has required close coordination with suppliers, tight process control and careful evaluation of process data. Ongoing efforts are focused on reducing cost and improving schedule performance.

ref.mixed-citation: LeVesque, R. J., M.M. Ho, B. D. Vickers, H.W. Babel and A. G. Pard, "Black Anodize as a Thermal Control Coating for Space Station Freedom," AIAA paper no. 92-2160, Ameri- can Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, AIAA Materials Specialist Conference, Dallas, TX, 16-17 April 1992.

David, K. E., and H. W. Babel, "Optical Property Degra- dation of Anodic Coatings in the Space Station Low Earth Orbit," AIAA paper no. 92-2162, American Institute of Aero- nautics and Astronautics, AIAA Materials Specialist Confer- ence, Dallas, TX, 16-17 April 1992.

Daneman, S. A., H. W. Babel, and M. M. Thomlinson, "Advancements in Long-Life Thermal Control Coatings for Low Earth Orbit Applications," SAE Paper No. 932229, Soci- ety of Automotive Engineers, Colorado Springs, CO, 12-15 July 1993.

Jones, C. A., K. E. David, R. J. LeVesque, II, and H. W. Babel, "Environmental Effects on Passive Thermal Control Materials of the Space Station Freedom," IAF Paper No. IAF- 93-1.4.233, 44th IAF Conference, Graz, Austria, 16-22 Octo- ber 1993.

Jones, C. A., R. J. LeVesque, II, K. E. David, and H. W. Babel, "Modification of Commercial Sulfuric Acid Anodize Processes for Control of Thermal Properties," IAF Paper No. IAF-94-1.5.208, 45th IAF Conference, Jerusalem, Israel, 9-14 October 1994.
